title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.01
frontText: Name three things that are contained within an operating system.
backText: Here are six: the kernel, command‐line shells, graphical user interface, utility programs, libraries, productivity programs.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.02
frontText: In text mode, after you log in you will see a ________ _______, which allows you to start programs and utilities.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.03
frontText: List three features commonly found in graphical user interfaces (GUIs).
backText: Here are five: program launchers, file managers, window controls, multiple desktops, and logout options.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.04
frontText: The ___ _______ is an effort by the Free Software Foundation to develop open source replacements for all the core elements of the Unix system.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.05
frontText: What is a Linux distribution?
backText: A bundle consisting of the Linux kernel, core Unix tools, supplemental software, startup scripts, and an installer

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.06
frontText: What are the three types of cloud computing methods?
backText: Public clouds, private clouds, and hybrid clouds

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.07
frontText: Name three of the Free Software Foundation’s (FSF) freedoms.
backText: Here are all four of the Free Software Foundation’s (FSF) freedoms: freedom to use the software for any purpose; freedom to examine the source code and modify it as you see fit; freedom to redistribute the software; and freedom to redistribute your modified software.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.08
frontText: The variant of the GNU GPL that is typically used for software libraries is the _____.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.09
frontText: The _____ organization has the goal of helping the creative culture combat problems with permissions related to copyrights on earlier works.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.10
frontText: Name three open source licenses (or license suites).
backText: Here are five: GNU GPL, GNU LGPL, BSD, MIT, and Apache.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.11
frontText: The _____ was founded as an umbrella organization for open source software and advocates open source in the business world.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.12
frontText: The terms _____ and _____ are used as umbrella terms that refer to both free, and open source software and development.
backText: free and open source (FOSS) and free/libre open source software (FLOSS)

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.13
frontText: Linus Torvalds created Linux as a ____‐compatible OS kernel.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.14
frontText: The two popular types of OS kernels are __________ and ___________. Linux is an example of a ____________ kernel.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.15
frontText: ________ _________ are specialized devices that fulfill a specific purpose.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.16
frontText: List four server programs that run on Linux.
backText: Here are nine: Apache, sendmail, MySQL, Samba, CUPS, BIND, dhcpd, NTP, and VNC.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.17
frontText: Name two benefits of open source software.
backText: Here are four: better code, more flexibility, lower cost, and lack of vendor lock‐in.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.18
frontText: Name the four main categories of software development.
backText: Commercial software, shareware software, freeware, and open source software.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.19
frontText: A program called a _____ provides a text‐mode user interface inside a window. After you launch this program, you can run either text‐mode or GUI programs by typing their filenames in the window.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.20
frontText: Name five web browsers you can use on Linux.
backText: Here are six web browser programs you can use on Linux: Chrome, Firefox, Web, Konqueror, Lynx, and Opera.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.21
frontText: Name two office suites you can use on Linux. (This does not include running Microsoft Office on Wine.)
backText: Here are three office suites you can run on Linux: Calligra, Apache OpenOffice, and LibreOffice.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.22
frontText: Name two software suites you can use to set up a private file hosting cloud on Linux.
backText: Here are three software suites you can use to set up a private file hosting cloud on Linux: ownCloud, Nextcloud, and FileCloud.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.23
frontText: Within a year after its initial release, the _____ web server software package became the most popular web server on the Internet. The other popular web server software package on Linux, _____, is much newer and is sometimes used in a side‐by‐side architecture deployment.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.24
frontText: Name three package tools.
backText: Here are four package tools: dpkg, rpm, apt-get, and yum.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.25
frontText: The default shell in most Linux distributions is the _____ shell.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.26
frontText: To reach a virtual terminal, you press the _____ keystrokes, where n is equal to a virtual terminal number for the particular Linux distribution you are using.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.27
frontText: When a person enters cat File.txt at the command line, _____ is the command, and ______ is the argument.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.28
frontText: The _____ environment variable is a set of colon‐delimited directory names, which the shell searches in sequence whenever you type a command that it doesn’t handle directly.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.29
frontText: When you have started a program from the command line, you can press _____ to suspend it and then run it in the background by typing the bg command.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.30
frontText: To view the history command’s man page, type _____ _____ at the command line and press Enter.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.31
frontText: Name the two CPU families commonly found on desktop computers.
backText: The x86 family for 32‐bit systems and the x86‐64 family for 64‐bit systems

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.32
frontText: Name one command‐line command you could use to determine the CPU of your Linux system.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.33
frontText: The _____ command lists the different boards plugged into the computer motherboard.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.34
frontText: Currently, what are the three common disk interfaces used in desktop computers?
backText: The most common disk interfaces used in desktops are PATA, SATA, and NVMe.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.35
frontText: Name two command‐line tools you can use to partition hard drives in Linux.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.36
frontText: Name three filesystem types that are commonly found on Linux systems:
backText: Here are five: ext4fs, ReiserFS, JFS, XFS, and Btrfs.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.37
frontText: The __________ _________ _______ defines a standard location for Linux system and user files.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.38
frontText: In Linux, the ____ directory is used to store configuration files for applications.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.39
frontText: Name two common locations for storing executable files in Linux.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.40
frontText: The __ command‐line command displays the contents of directories.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.41
frontText: To copy a file, use the __ command‐line command, but to rename a file, use the __ command‐line command.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.42
frontText: To delete a directory that contains file, you must use the ____ command‐line command.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.43
frontText: When used in regular expressions, the _____ represents a single character that can be any character.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.44
frontText: To determine the number of words, bytes, and/or lines in a text file, use the _____ command.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.45
frontText: When using the cut command, if the delimiter for each text file line is not a tab, you designate the delimiter using the _____ option.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.46
frontText: To run a program and redirect its standard error to a new file, use the _____ symbol combination.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.47
frontText: Besides backticks (`) and the $() format, you can use the _____ utility to generate commands.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.48
frontText: To uncompress a file that has been compressed with gzip, use the _____ command.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.49
frontText: The two most common package management systems used in Linux distributions are the _______________ and the ____________.
backText: RPM Package Manager; Debian package system

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.50
frontText: Package management systems store their software packages in ____________ to make them easily accessible from the Internet.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.51
frontText: The _____ command‐line command is commonly used for working with RPM packages, whereas the _______ command‐line command is used when working with Debian packages.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.52
frontText: What command‐line tools should you use to view a list of the processes currently running on the Linux system?

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.53
frontText: Which command‐line tools sorts the processes based on CPU usage or memory usage, making it a valuable tool to use when troubleshooting system issues?

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.54
frontText: Most Linux distributions use the __________ directory to store critical system log files.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.55
frontText: Name two text‐mode editors.
backText: Here are three text‐mode editors: vi (vim), nano, and emacs.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.56
frontText: Name three GUI text editors.
backText: Here are five GUI editors: emacs, gedit, KWrite, Kate, and Geany.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.57
frontText: In the nano text editor, the bottom two lines show a summary of some of the most common operations, along with the _____ that trigger them.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.58
frontText: If you are new to text‐mode editing, it is best to start with the _____ editor.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.59
frontText: If you have already saved your text file modifications, you can simply exit the nano editor by pressing the _____ key combination.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.60
frontText: Name the vi text editor’s three modes.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.61
frontText: In a shell script, what is used to define the shell used to run the script?
backText: The first line in the script must have the shebang characters (#!), followed by the path to the shell.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.62
frontText: In shell scripts, _________ are used to store data in memory to recall for use later in the script.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.63
frontText: To send data to a shell script, you can include the values as ________ in the command line when you start the script.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.64
frontText: Name two types of loops that you can use in shell scripts.
backText: Here are three: for loops, while loops, and until loops.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.65
frontText: What command should you use in a shell script to display data back to the command line for the shell user to see?
backText: The echo command allows you to display text and variables in the command line.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.66
frontText: How can you inform the shell user that an error occurred within the shell processing?
backText: Use the exit command to return a specific exit value indicating the error.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.67
frontText: On a modern Linux distribution, the _____ file holds user account passwords.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.68
frontText: Which account type do most common users have—system or standard?
backText: Most common users have a standard account type. (System accounts are used by daemons to provide services on a Linux system.)

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.69
frontText: Name the seven fields in an /etc/passwd file record.
backText: The seven field names in an /etc/passwd file record are username, password, UID, GID, comment, home directory, and default shell.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.70
frontText: Name the nine fields in an /etc/shadow file record.
backText: username, password, last password change, days until a change is allowed, days before a change is required, days to warn before expiration, days between expiration and deactivation, expiration date, and special flag.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.71
frontText: Name the four fields in an /etc/group file record.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.72
frontText: To obtain super user privileges, if you can, is it better to log into the root account or use the sudo command?
backText: To obtain super user privileges, in most cases it is better to use the sudo command.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.73
frontText: To create a user account at the command line, use super user privileges and the ____ program.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.74
frontText: When a user account is created, if configured to do so, what directory are files copied from to the new account’s home directory?

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.75
frontText: To modify a user account at the command line, not the account’s password, use super user privileges and the ____ program.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.76
frontText: To remove a user account at the command line, use super user privileges and the _____ program.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.77
frontText: Name three utilities you can use to determine whether a user is currently logged into the system, prior to attempting to modify their account.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.78
frontText: Using super user privileges, which three utilities allow you to add, remove, and modify groups?

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.79
frontText: What command‐line option can you use with the ls command to display the owner of a file?

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.80
frontText: The _____ command allows you to change the owner assigned to a file.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.81
frontText: What three categories of permissions does Linux track to protect files?
backText: Linux assigns separate permissions for the file user, the primary group of the file, and permissions for all other users on the system.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.82
frontText: The _____ command allows you to change the permissions assigned to a file.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.83
frontText: What are the two modes you can use to define permissions for a file or directory?
backText: The symbolic mode uses three groups of three characters: r for read, w for write, and x for execute permissions. The octal mode uses three octal values (0–7) to indicate the permissions.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.84
frontText: The ______ ___ is helpful for creating shared folders, as it tells Linux to store files saved in a directory with the group permissions assigned to the directory and not the user.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.85
frontText: What are the five pieces of information you normally need to configure for a Linux system to work on a network?
backText: The host address, the network subnet address, the default router, the system host name, and a DNS server address

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.86
frontText: The ______________ tool is a graphical tool commonly used in Linux distributions to set network configurations.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.87
frontText: Name two command‐line tools you can use to configure network settings on a Linux system.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.88
frontText: What command‐line tool can you use to test connectivity to a remote host?
backText: The ping (for IPv4 addresses) and ping6 (for IPv6 addresses) command‐line tools use ICMP messages to test the network connectivity to a remote host.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.89
frontText: Name two commands that can display information about the open connections on your Linux system.

title: fc657699.LinxEssSG.90
frontText: Name two command‐line commands that you can use to find information on network hosts.
